Backgammon

Class BackgammonAIPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • aima.core.search.adversarial.IterativeDeepeningAlphaBetaSearch<BackgammonState,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>
      • Backgammon.BackgammonAIPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AdversarialSearch<BackgammonState,java.lang.Integer>

    public class BackgammonAIPlayer
extends IterativeDeepeningAlphaBetaSearch<BackgammonState,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>
    Implements an Iterative Deepening Adversarial Search with Alpha-Beta Pruning and chance nodes.
    Author:
    Andrew Socha

    • Method Detail

      • isSignificantlyBetter

        protected boolean isSignificantlyBetter(double newUtility,
                                        double utility)
        Checks if one utility is significantly better than another. Used by the AI to end its search early if it finds one move that is way better than all others.
        Overrides:
        isSignificantlyBetter in class IterativeDeepeningAlphaBetaSearch<BackgammonState,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        newUtility - the newly found utility (currently the best one the AI has found) (0-1)
        utility - the utility that was previously the best on the AI had found (0-1)
        Returns:
        true if the new utility is significantly better than the old one, false otherwise

      • makeDecision

        public java.lang.Integer makeDecision(BackgammonState state)
        Figures out what move the AI player will make using Iterative Deepening Adversarial Search with Alpha-Beta Pruning
        Specified by:
        makeDecision in interface AdversarialSearch<BackgammonState,java.lang.Integer>
        Overrides:
        makeDecision in class IterativeDeepeningAlphaBetaSearch<BackgammonState,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        state - the current game state
        Returns:
        the move that the AI choose (0-25 or 50-75, or -1 for no valid moves)

      • maxValue

        public double maxValue(BackgammonState state,
                       java.lang.String player,
                       double alpha,
                       double beta,
                       int depth)
        Determines the maximum estimated utility that can be obtained from all of the possible moves avaliable in a game state
        Overrides:
        maxValue in class IterativeDeepeningAlphaBetaSearch<BackgammonState,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        state - any game state
        player - the current player (of the game, not necessarily the state)
        alpha - alpha for alpha-beta pruning
        beta - beta for alpha-beta pruning
        depth - the depth in the search tree
        Returns:
        the calculated utility
